datafield.subfield: Charter and expenses, 1666 February 19, for the Royal Hospital in Dublin :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.
Foundation charter for hospital for injured or aged soldiers, followed by a list of thirty-six governors and six elected alternates, and detailed annual expense accounts for the hospital.

MS 3327, Container 78: Armorial bookplate of L. H. King Harman, of Newcastle, Ballymahon, County Longford, Ireland; blue label of The Brick Row Book Shop, Austin, Texas, on inside back cover; acquired by the Ransom Center in 1964. Binding: Full brown tanned calfskin over paper boards. Straight caps, tight back over sewing supports, cut-solid edges, all gilded. Stain decoration (red/black mottled/spattered); gold-tooled (i) two-line border intersecting corners, (ii) concentric two-line and decorative roll frames, (iii) cornerpieces, (iv) additional motifs, front and back covers; gold-tooled decorative roll board edges; gold-tooled two-line panel frames; no title. No endbands. Endleaf components, all same off-white handmade laid paper as text block: front four (of ten leaves) integral endleaves making pastedown and three free endleaves; back final nine (of twelve) leaves of penultimate gathering text blanks, final gathering of eight leaves, integral endleaves, making pastedown and seven free endleaves. (England/Ireland? 17th c?)
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
